div1.p: I have the honor to inform you that Mr Juluis A. de C. Balsemão, a resident here has made an application to me in which he desires to have himself recognized as an American Citizen.

He has presented to me a Declaration on oath dated in New York, 22nd March 1858 in which he states his intention of becoming a Citizen of the United States of America, and renouncing all allegiance to any other Government.

I have also the honor to inclose a certified copy of this
The Honble
Secretary of the State,
Washington
Untied States of America.
a Naturalization paper from the United States, or whether such a document can be furnished from the Consulate here; for the Consular Instructions are void of information for guidance in cases of this kind.

I have the honor to be
Sir,
Your most Obedt Servant
Robt S Newton
Vice Commercial Agent

State of New York.
In the Court of Common Pleas, for the City and County of New York.

I, Julius A. de C. Balsimão do declare on Oath, that it is bona fide my Intention to become a Citizen of the United States, and to renounce for ever all allegiance and fidelity to any foreign Prince, potentate, State or Sovereignty whatever, and particularly to the Queen of Portugal.

Sworn this 22nd day of March 1858.
(signed) Julius A. de C Balsimão
Clerks office, Court of Common Pleas, for the City and County of New York.
I certify that the foregoing is a true Copy of an original Declaration of Intention remaining of record in my office.
In witness whereof I have hereunto subscribed my name, and affixed the Seal of the said Court, this 22nd day of March 1858.
U.S. Commercial Agency St. Paul de Loanda, 24th Janry 1871
I hereby certify that the above is a true and correct copy of the document referred to in my despatch to the Honble Secretary of State dated 24th, Janry 1871.

Robt S Newton
Vice Commercial Agent
